newsitem.title: FINLAND: Lipponen to U.S., markka ERM-link not this weekend.
newsitem.headline: Lipponen to U.S., markka ERM-link not this weekend.

text.p: The Finnish markka is highly unlikely to be linked to Europe's exchange rate mechanism this weekend because Prime Minister Paavo Lipponen travels to the United States on Sunday, an official close to Lipponen said.
"No, it is hardly possible," the official said, speaking on condition of anonymity.

Lipponen, chairman of Finland's Social Democratic Party, is due to participate in a Socialist International meeting in New York. He leaves Finland on Sunday and is due to return on Wednesday morning, a spokesman at the Prime Minister's Office said.

If the government decided to link the markka to ERM this weekend the Prime Minister should remain in the country. Key decision-making bodies, including the cabinet, must be ready to meet at short notice when a link is imminent, according to the Currency Act.
Lipponen has said a decision on a link would be made over a weekend so that an announcement could be made before foreign exchange markets open the next Monday.
Finland has repeatedly said a decision whether to link the markka to ERM will be made this autumn.
